The Map Room is currently disabled in Backyard Monsters Refitted.

We are aiming to get this working for our beta release.

For more information join our discord.
Inferno is currently disabled in Backyard Monsters Refitted. For more information visit out discord.

map_cannot_recycle_map_room3: You cannot recycle your Map Room in the New World Map. If you want to relocate your yard, click on your Town Hall and choose Relocate.
fp_radiotower: Nervous about leaving your Yard vulnerable? Build a Radio Tower and get attack alerts while you're away.

popup.title: Juice all monsters?
popup.body: Are you sure you want to juice all monsters?

noshiny.title: All out of shiny.
noshiny.body: You can purchase more shiny in the store.

levelup.title: Congratulations!
levelup.headline: You're now Level {v1}
levelup.body: Keep up the good work and don't forget to brag about it.

goldenmushroom.title: Your worker struct gold!
goldenmushroom.desc: You've picked a golden mushroom worth {v1} Shiny. Mushrooms grow back every day.

oops.title: Oops, something broke!
oops.body:
Reasons for errors include(but are not limited to):
* Having the game open in more than 1 place.
* Loss of internet connection.
* Your computer running too slowly.

We've logged the error, please reload to continue.

pop.experiencebar: You have {v1} experience points and need {v2} more to reach Level {v3}

afk.title: Anyone home?
afk.body: Hmm.. it seems like you may be ideal.

timeout.title: Oops.. timeout!
timeout.body: It looks like the game was left idle for too long, and has timed out. Please start the game again.

worker.waitforfinish: Please wait for a worker to finish their task.

FULL

Production paused, bank to resume production
ui.needmoreroom:
Not enough room.
Build more or upgrade existing storage silos

worker.speedup: Speed-up a worker's task for {v1} Shiny.

gcage.title: CHAMPION CAGE
gcage.instantBuffAdd: Add another buff instantly with Shiny!
gcage.feedBuffDesc: Each day you feed your Champion Monster will further improve his abilities, up to a maximum of three times. Careful though, if he's not fed everyday, he will weaken.

townhall.desc: The hub of any great yard and the first building you need to build. Upgrading the Town Hall unlocks new buildings, features and lets you upgrade other buildings to a higher level.

snipertower.desc: Long range, high damage, but slow to reload. This tower picks off enemy monsters before they even get close. Protect a larger area with this tower.

cannontower.desc: Short range but high damage, this tower's shells explode on impact, great for taking out tightly-packed groups.

twigsnapper.desc: Produces Twigs. Used in the construction of buildings

pebbleshiner.desc: Produces Pebbles. Used in the construction of buildings

goofactory.desc: Produces Goo. Goo is used in the Hatchery to produce monsters.

puttysquisher.desc: Produces Putty. Used in the construction of buildings

storagesilo.desc: Increase your bank's capacity of Twigs, Pebbles, Putty and Goo.

monsterlocker.desc: Research and unlock new monsters to hatch in the Hatchery.

housing.desc: Stores the creatures you produce in the Hatchery, upgrade or build more to increase capacity.

flinger.desc: The Flinger flings monsters into battle. This building is required if you wish to attack another player. Use the Map Room to find and target enemy yards.

maproom.desc: Look around the world, find and help friends and select other player yards to attack.

monsteracademy.desc: Through a demanding curriculum of physics, philosophy and physical education, your monsters will earn their PhD in Advanced Destruction. Failing that, we have a large supply of steroids.

hatchery.desc: Converts Goo produced by the Goo Factory into the monsters you have unlocked in the Monster Locker.

hcc.desc: Control all of your Hatcheries from a single building. You add monsters to one build queue and it sends instructions to whichever Hatchery becomes available first.

catapult.desc: A siege weapon, the Catapult hurls twigs at enemy bases to damage buildings. Upgrade to increase firepower.

monsterlab.desc: Research top secret abilities for your monsters. In war, science rules.

wildmonsterbaiter.desc: The Wild Monster Baiter sprays a musk into the air that Wild Monsters can't resist, causing them to flock to your base, a great way to test your defenses. If it gets too much for you the building has a siren you can use to scare them off.

yardplanner.desc: Quickly move some things around or completely remodel your layout! This building gives you a birds-eye view of your yard and makes moving buildings a snap.

monsterjuicer.desc: Got some unwanted monsters in your Housing? Want to make some space for bigger and better things? Want to make a sacrifice to the Backyard Gods? Then this is the building for you! Recycle Monsters back into Goo with minimal suffering.

generalstore.desc: Spend your Shiny on time-saving upgrades.

boobytrap.desc: Invisible to the enemy until it's too late. Triggered when a Monster steps on it, deals large damage to a small area. Place close to buildings or use walls to group attackers into a small place.

woodenblock.desc: A simple brown block, used to build wall to protect buildings and channel attackers into traps or closer to towers. Can be upgraded from wood to stone to metal to gold to black diamond!

teslatower.desc: Talk about evil science, this high voltage tower fries any enemy that gets within range. Upgrade to improve, number of shocks per charge, damage per shock, and range.

lasertower.desc: Deadly and fast, this plasma energy tower zaps any invading enemy at the speed of light. Great for taking out packed groups of monsters.

railguntower.desc: An electrical gun that accelerates a conductive projectile along a pair of rails, the Railgun tower makes up for its slow reload with high damage and an infinite line of fire.

flaktower.desc: Fast-firing cannon designed to nullify or reduce the effectiveness of hostile air action.

monsterbunker.desc: This defensive housing allows monsters to fight to death defending your base.

monstercage.desc: Hatch and Evolve a Champion Monster to attack enemies and defend your base.

championchamber.desc: This building allows you to change out your active champ, keeping inactive ones safe on ice until you call them forth again. (Frozen champs aren't hurt even when the Champion Chamber is completely destroyed.)

heavytrap.desc: Invisible to your enemies until it's too late, Heavy Traps use a specialized trigger that only fires when the most powerful monsters step on it, but cause splash damage to all nearby units.

spurtzcannon.desc: Your very own Backyard Shotgun! This cannon fires a spurtz militia to do your bidding - Just what you need to stop groups of invaders dead in their tracks.

blackspurtzcannon.desc: The Black Diamond Spurtz Cannon boasts stronger durability and reduced loading times. Your enemies will need a monster miracle to get past these!

build.desc: Never be caught off guard again! Get e-mail alerts while you're away from your yard.

radio.desc: Never be caught off guard again! Get e-mail alerts while you're away from your yard.
radio.saveFail:
Hmm.. seems like the broadcast frequency is broken.

Radio channel not available on Backyard Monsters Refitted.

producing.message: Select monsters from below to add to the queue.

capacity.desc: Capacity of all your Houses combined

juicing.txt:
Juice Monsters:
Juice selected monsters from your housing.

mon.drulldesc: Covered in red obsidian scales, this two-headed beast delivers overwhelming damage during attacks.
mon.gorgodesc: Discovered inside the Bermuda Triangle, Gorgo is a powerful 'tank' monster of simian origin.
mon.fomordesc: Known in the nothern isles as the 'Flying Frog of Death', Fomor's presence provides a 'buff' to your monster army, granting armor and speed to nearby monsters.
mon.korathdesc: Spawned in the magma pits of Inferno, Korath uses his massive body and fiery core to eliminate enemies.
mon.pokeydesc:
Like a swarm of ants, a roaming pack of Pokeys can devour a grown cow in less than five minutes.
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.octooozedesc:
The slimy octo-ooze soaks up fire power like a sponge so other monsters can wreak havoc.
Favorite Target: Defensive Towers
mon.boltdesc:
Bolt is fast as lightning and can run ahead of your other monsters to munch on buildings with its razor sharp teeth.
Favorite Target: Harvesters, Town Halls and Silos
mon.finkdesc:
Found deep inside Amazonia, Fink's chemo-receptors makes its attacks deadly accurate.
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.eyeradesc:
Warning: Eye-ra's chemical makeup combusts within close proximity to walls.
Favorite Target: Walls
mon.ichidesc:
Discovered in the peak of Mt. Fuji, Ichi is one of the deadliest monsters and can withstand intense damage from towers and booby traps.
Favorite Target: Defensive Towers
mon.banditodesc:
Bandito's thick exoskeleton and impeccable accuracy make it the perfect monster assassin.
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.fangdesc:
Fang's bite releases a toxic venom which liquidates any target.
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.braindesc:
Cunning and greedy, Brain's pulsating cerebral cortex and high intelligence make him perfect for looting resources.
Favorite Target: Harvesters, Town Halls and Silos
mon.crabatrondesc:
Using its claws to snap towers like twigs, Crabatron strikes fear into the heart of its enemies.
Favorite Target: Defensive Towers
mon.projectxdesc:
A government experiment gone terribly wrong, Project X is programmed to attack defense towers in battle.
Favorite Target: Defensive Towers
mon.zafreetidesc:
From deep within the Sahara, comes the mystical Zafreeti healer.
Favorite Target: Your Monsters (heal), Zafreeti doesn't heal other Vorgs or Zafreetis
mon.teratorndesc:
With its swift wings and fiery breath, the flying Teratorn rains death from above.
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.wormzerdesc:
Wormzer utilizes his burrowing ability to launch surprise attacks and evade even the toughest walled defense
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.davedesc:
D.A.V.E only listens to his master and has a habit of completely destroying bases.
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.slimeattikusdesc:
An unholy biological terror birthed in the Bangweulu Swamps of Zambia, the Slimeattikus dissolves foes on contact and fissions when attacked.
Favorite Target: Anything
mon.vorgdesc:
Hatched in giant hives deep inside the asteroid belt, Vorg are flying alien healers with a penchant for mischief
Favorite Target: Your Monsters (heal)
mon.infounlocked:
Unlocked
Produce in your Hatchery or train in your Monster Academy.
mon.confirmcancel: Are you sure you want to stop unlocking {v1}?
mon.infounlocking:
Unlocking
Press "Speed Up" to reduce the time remaining.
mon.alreadyunlocking: You are already unlocking a monster.

tut.1b:
Hey {v1},

Welcome to Backyard Monsters!
Click Full Screen to view more of your Yard.

NWM.Step2:
Let's build a Sniper Tower to defend your yard.

Click on the Buildings menu.
NWM.Step3:
Here you can browse all the different buildings you can add to your yard.

Click the Defensive buildings tab.
NWM.Step5: Here you can see the description, requirements and cost of the Sniper Tower. Press Build.
NWM.Step6: Now place it in your yard by clicking on the grass.
NWM.Step7: Click on the Sniper Tower and select Speed Up.
NWM.Step8:
Buy "Close Enough" to finish the upgrade instantly.

The "Close Enough" speed-up is free for upgrades with 5 minutes or less remaining.
NWM.Step9: Your Sniper Tower is complete and will now fire on any intruders that try to attack your base. Collect your reward!
NWM.Step10:
WHOA! Just in time, here come some Wild Monsters!

Don't worry, the Sniper Tower should make short work of them, just sit back and watch the action.
NWM.Step11: Oooh, looks like you completed a rather bloody quest for defending your yard. Don't forget to collect the reward by clicking on Quests menu.
NWM.Step12: That attack came from the nearby Legionnaire Wild Monster Tribe. Let's strike back before they get a chance to build up a larger attack
NWM.Step13: The first thing we need to do is build housing for your monster army. Click on the Buildings menu.
NWM.Step17:
Place it somewhere in your backyard.

You can click and drag to move the backyard around to find space.
NWM.Step18: Select your Monster Housing, then click on Speed Up.
NWM.Step20:
We've recruited some Pokeys to help. Pokeys are a little slow and small but what they lack in strength they make up for in numbers!

Collect your reward now.
NWM.Step21: Now let's build a Flinger so we can fling our Pokeys into the enemy backyard. Click on the Buildings menu.
NWM.Step24: Place it somewhere in your backyard (remember, you can click and drag to find space).
NWM.Step25: Click on the Flinger and select Speed Up.
NWM.Step26: Since the Flinger takes longer than 5 minutes to build, let's buy the "Finish Building NOW!" speed-up
NWM.Step27: Now let's build a Map Room so we can find the Wild Monster Tribe. Click on the Buildings menu.
NWM.Step31: Click on the Map Room and select Speed Up.
NWM.Step33:
Now let's use the Map Room to find the Wild Monster Tribe that attacked you and strike back with our Pokey army!

Click on the Map menu.

tut.99: Time to collect some quest rewards for all that new construction!

kozu.name: Kozu Tribe
kozu.taunt: We'll be back for your bones!

abunakki.taunt: We'll be back for your bones!
